title.rendered: A Beautiful Roadside Affair: Take a Bite Out of India’s Street Food Culture

content.rendered:
From masala chai to pani puri; from parathas to vada pav, Indian Street Food is a journey that no true-blue foodie should miss out on. When looking back upon its history, you’ll come across vendors who claim to have served the Mughal Kings (who are we to say any different?) while others place the beginnings of the tradition with Mumbai factory cooks. Using the day’s leftover vegetables and spices, they would create delicious, affordable meals for workers heading home after the midnight shift.  

Why Do People Love Indian Street Food So Much?  

Whatever the origins, there is no doubt that when it comes to street food, India tops the charts. From pani puris, affectionately known as the flavorful bombs of Bengal, to chole bhature, a spicy and hearty chickpea curry, Indian street food is an assault on all the senses, in the best way possible.  

 

These aromatic, bright, and delicious treats are as diverse and colorful as the country itself. Known for their authentic taste, variety, and easy accessibility, they have quickly become a worldwide sensation.  

 

Some of the reasons why Indian street food has seen such a quick global rise include:  

 

  1. It Brings People Together. Street food opens the doors for people of all cultures, class, and races to share and enjoy a delicious meal. In doing so, it becomes a universal language for people to cherish their unity and diversity.  

 

  1. It’s Authentic. Indian street food may surprise you with some modern twists now and then, but in most cases, the focus remains strongly on traditional flavor. The simplicity and original recipes are delicately and respectfully preserved so you can discover the rich history behind every delicious (and spicy!) bite.  

 

  1. It Offers Unmatched Diversity. Almost every country has its own street food traditions, from the Pad Thai stalls in Thailand to the tamales and tacos of Mexico, but the diversity of Indian street food makes it special. From bhel puris and speakeasy sandwiches, to thali spreads and banana-leaf steamed fish, India is home to an extraordinary smorgasbord of street food across its twenty nine states.  

 

  1. It’s a Sensory Experience. There is more to Indian street food than meets the eye – it’s a true treat for all your senses. You’ll witness the cooking process, smell the food and hear the sounds all at once. You aren’t just touching or tasting it, but experiencing it as a whole when observing the fresh quality of ingredients, the expert way the food is handled, and the pure joy of creating a dish out of love.  

 

Welcome to Desi Loco 

It’s a true spectacle over here at Desi Loco! With the authentic flavors of India and the vibrant energy of the markets, railways, and streets, Desi Loco brings a one-of-a-kind dining experience to Kenya. We have a passion to eat, a passion to cook, and a passion to share – so come on in and fill your belly with all the crunchy, tangy, and delightful Indian street snacks you want!  

 

While our lively space evokes the feel of old-world, urban India, our modern dishes, craft cocktails, and bright pink Mumbai-inspired dining bus brings a whole load of fun to the diverse and flavorful cuisine. Here, you’re not just a bystander. Our food is fresh and prepared right in front of you, making you an important part of the process.  

Take Your Taste Buds on an Adventure Like No Other   

Desi Loco calls up the aromas and taste of foods found on India’s iconic bustling streets and you can begin that discovery right in the heart of Nairobi. To find out more or to book your table today, contact us at +254 707 800 800 or info@nairobistreetkitchen.com

title.rendered: G & Tea Time – Gin Cocktails & High Tea
Let’s Go Local: 5 Reasons Why You Should Be Supporting Kenyan Artists

content.rendered:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Nairobi’s creative community has so much to offer, yet when it comes to buying artwork for our homes or offices, many of us are still hanging mass-produced prints on our walls. With so much incredible talent right in our own backyard, we can’t help but wonder why.  

At Nairobi Street Kitchen, we truly believe that supporting local artists contributes to the success of the community, which is why we’ve created a platform where art lovers can connect easily with Kenyan creatives of all experience levels and from all walks of life.  

URBAN ARTS & CULTURE AT NSK  

So whether you’re looking for your first-ever original artwork, or you’re an avid collector searching for that next special piece, here are 5 reasons why you should go local (you can thank us later).   

1. You’ll Have a Stronger Connection to the Art  

It’s likely that you share everyday experiences, struggles, and joys with those living in your own community. Kenyan artists are so influenced by their local culture and hometown that they’ll capture that familiarity in their work, allowing you to have a much stronger connection to it.  

More than that, because local art reflects the places and people in the region it was created, it cultivates a strong sense of cultural identity. You, or anyone visiting your space, will be able to see themselves reflected in the piece, and that sense of belonging is a very powerful thing.  

2. You’ll Help Enrich the Cultural Fabric of Your City  

Local artists contribute to the cultural well-being and growth of a community. Their work adds vibrancy to the city and can open us up to new ideas and ways of thinking. Their pieces also serve as a reflection of our history, culture, and current moment, whether that’s through custom paintings, sidewalk art, or murals.  

While the tendency is to indulge in popular culture or store-bought prints, supporting Nairobi’s creatives is essential in building our community. Not only will your purchase give them a voice and stronger presence, but supporting local artists will motivate them to work more, inevitably leading to a city that is financially and culturally richer and more valuable.  

3. You’ll Be Able to Customize Your Piece 

Custom artwork lets your personality and space shine in a way that no store-bought piece ever will. One of the biggest benefits of discovering an artist in your own community is that you can connect with them. Many welcome commissions and will create artwork tailored to your life and space.   

You might even get the opportunity to talk with the artist and understand them better. They can let you in on the emotions that drove the process, the true inspiration behind their work, or even make suggestions on what piece they would recommend based on your particular needs.   

4. You’ll Strengthen Your Local Economy  

When you buy from local retailers, be it a piece of art, fresh produce, or artisanal goods, you’re taking important steps to support your local economy – something that is now more important than ever. By investing in the work of a local artist, the money cycles back into your community, and everyone does better for it.  

You’ll Also Do Your Part for the Environment  

Many Kenyan artists craft their pieces from materials they find in nature or in local recycle businesses, and some even reuse their own scrap parts. So in addition to helping your economy, buying local will give you the chance to do your part in building a more sustainable and eco-friendly future.  

READ ABOUT OUR ECO-FRIENDLY ARTISTS  

 

5. Shopping Locally Makes For a Fun Experience  

Shopping online for mass produced prints may be convenient, but nothing beats the experience of visiting an indoor market or a thriving local hangout when searching for your next art piece.  

When you visit Nairobi Street Kitchen, not only will you be able to connect more with the creative community, but you’ll also get to indulge in some great live music, sample awesome food and cocktails, and get handmade local art and other items from the Nairobi Street Kiosk.  

Looking for your next gift idea?  

Candles are nice, but you can only give so many before that gets old. The gift of local art is truly unique, personal, and helps support local businesses all in one.  

Local Shopping at Your Fingertips  

Our carefully-curated marketplace brings locally-made goods and entertainment to your fingertips. We’re proud to connect the community with passionate creatives, musicians, and bespoke sellers, all in support of independent businesses and artists.  

 

To discover more about how you can support local businesses, contact us at +254 707 800 800 or info@nairobistreetkitchen.com 

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

title.rendered: “4 Simple Ways to Ease into a Vegan Lifestyle – and Stick to It”

content.rendered:
[vc_section][vc_row][vc_column width=”1/2″ offset=”vc_col-lg-offset-2 vc_col-lg-8″][vc_column_text]Interested in becoming a vegan? You’re not alone! This growing trend is no surprise – especially considering that it’s one of the best ways to move towards a more compassionate way of living – for the animals, the planet, and your health.

But if you’ve been a lifelong meat-eater, it’s hard to know where to start. Luckily, there are a few easy steps you can take to start this journey – and whether you’re doing it for health reasons, ethical concerns, or just out of curiosity, you’ve come to the right place!

We’ve outlined 4 simple steps that will help you ease into a plant-based lifestyle, and stick to it.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

1. Be Clear on Your Reasons for Going Vegan

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Before you begin this transition, make a list of all the reasons why you are going plant-based. There is no doubt that a vegan diet has many benefits, and some of the reasons why people are increasingly adopting this way of life include:

  • Weight loss
  • Long-term health benefits
  • Compassion towards animals
  • Environmental sustainability

Remember that veganism is a significant lifestyle change that requires ongoing determination and commitment. Being completely clear as to why you want to make the shift will help you stick to it in the long run.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

2. Look for Delicious Alternatives

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]One of the biggest challenges for new vegans is missing the taste of foods like chocolates, cheese, and burgers. If you’re worried that the love of your old favorite foods could derail your new lifestyle, do your research and seek out some vegan-friendly swaps.

Contrary to what you might have heard, going vegan doesn’t mean grazing on raw veggies or having to survive on bland food! There is a whole world of tasty options out there, including vegan cheese and milk alternatives that will make this transition painless and oh-so-delicious![/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

3. Learn Your Way Around a Vegan Kitchen

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Vegan cooking is remarkably easy to learn and delivers all sorts of unexpected rewards. With just a little practice and exploration, you’ll soon become an expert and invariably enjoy fresher, tastier meals with higher quality ingredients.

Want to kickstart your meatless journey with a dish that not only satisfies your taste buds and fills you up, but also doesn’t require a lot of prep work? Check out the delicious and simple vegan recipe from our chef below![/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Recipe: Whole Roasted Cauliflower Steak with NSK House Salad (Serves 3)

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class=”hide-content”]

NSK Products Used: Jamaican Jerk Rub, NSK Salsa Macha

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

Ingredients for Cauliflower:

1 Medium Whole Head of Cauliflower (leaves picked, stems trimmed, but left on)
4 Tbsp Extra Virgin Olive Oil
2 Tbsp NSK Jamaican Jerk Rub
1 Tbsp NSK Salsa Macha
1 Tbsp Fresh Lemon Juice
1 Tsp Fresh Lemon Zest

Ingredients for NSK House Salad

1 Punnet Fresh Rocket Leaves
2 Tbsp Sun Dried Tomatoes (thinly sliced)
2 Tbsp Lemon Juice
4 Tbsp Olive Oil
2 Tbsp Raw Pumpkin Seeds
Salt and Pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower:
  1. In a medium mixing bowl, combine the olive oil, Jamaican Jerk Rub, Salsa Macha, lemon juice and lemon zest and mix with a whisk or fork until well combined.
  2. Take the marination mix and rub well all over the cauliflower, reserving 1 tbsp of marination for after cooking.
  3. Preheat your oven to 165 Degrees Celsius, and when heated, place the marinated cauliflower in the oven for 27 minutes, or until tender when pierced with a fork.
For the Salad:
  1. Combine lemon juice, olive oil, salt & pepper, and whisk until fully emulsified.
  2. Add the sundried tomatoes to the rocket leaves in a separate bowl
  3. When ready to serve, combine the dressing to the rocket and sundried tomatoes and garnish with pumpkin seeds.
Serving

Serve the roasted cauliflower with the house salad to enjoy a high protein, healthy lunch or dinner. You can thank us later![/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

4. Give Yourself a ‘Cheat’ Day

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Going vegan may just be one of the best things you could ever do for your health and the environment, but no one said it would be easy! If you’re ready to incorporate veganism into your day-to-day life, start by giving yourself an occasional ‘cheat’ day.

Don’t feel guilty about allowing yourself a few non-vegan comfort foods while you make this transition – it will give you the motivation to continue forward, one step at a time, into this wonderful and wholly compassionate lifestyle (and hey – doesn’t that mean showing yourself some compassion too?)[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]

We Promise Healthy Food and Happy Times

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Our final piece of advice is: shamelessly indulge while exploring the meatless universe! Our diverse collection of restaurants and bars offer a huge variety of delicious vegan meals, snacks, desserts, and take-home products that even the most rigid of carnivores will rave about.

To book a table or discover more about the locally produced, artisanal products available at our retail shop, contact us at +254 707 800 800 or info@nairobistreetkitchen.com.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][/vc_section]
